items.text: I can easily visualize how an object will look when rotated.
items.rationale: Visualizing objects in different orientations is a key aspect of perceptual reasoning.

items.text: She quickly identifies patterns in complex designs.
items.rationale: Pattern recognition is a fundamental component of perceptual reasoning.

items.text: I enjoy solving puzzles that require spatial thinking.
items.rationale: Spatial thinking is directly related to perceptual reasoning abilities.

items.text: He excels at tasks that involve assembling objects.
items.rationale: Assembling objects requires understanding spatial relationships, a key part of perceptual reasoning.

items.text: I can easily spot differences in similar images.
items.rationale: Spotting differences in images involves perceptual discrimination, a component of perceptual reasoning.

items.text: She is adept at interpreting visual information quickly.
items.rationale: Interpreting visual information is a core skill in perceptual reasoning.

items.text: I find it easy to understand diagrams and charts.
items.rationale: Understanding diagrams and charts requires perceptual reasoning skills.

items.text: He can mentally manipulate shapes with ease.
items.rationale: Mental manipulation of shapes is a key aspect of perceptual reasoning.

items.text: I am good at tasks that require visualizing three-dimensional objects.
items.rationale: Visualizing three-dimensional objects is a component of perceptual reasoning.

items.text: She can quickly understand how parts fit into a whole.
items.rationale: Understanding how parts fit into a whole is a perceptual reasoning skill.

items.text: I often use mental imagery to solve problems.
items.rationale: Using mental imagery is a strategy linked to perceptual reasoning.

items.text: He is skilled at recognizing geometric shapes in different contexts.
items.rationale: Recognizing geometric shapes involves perceptual reasoning.

items.text: I sometimes struggle with tasks that require quick visual analysis.
items.rationale: Struggling with visual analysis can indicate challenges in perceptual reasoning.

items.text: She occasionally finds it difficult to interpret complex visual data.
items.rationale: Difficulty with complex visual data can suggest perceptual reasoning challenges.

items.text: I am good at both visualizing objects and understanding verbal instructions.
items.rationale: This could relate to both perceptual reasoning and verbal comprehension.

items.text: I can quickly scan a page and find specific information.
items.rationale: Quickly scanning for information is a key aspect of processing speed.

items.text: He completes tasks rapidly without sacrificing accuracy.
items.rationale: Rapid task completion with accuracy is indicative of high processing speed.

items.text: I am able to process information quickly and efficiently.
items.rationale: Efficient information processing is a hallmark of processing speed.

items.text: She can quickly switch between different tasks.
items.rationale: Task switching speed is a component of processing speed.

items.text: I often finish timed tests with plenty of time to spare.
items.rationale: Finishing timed tests quickly indicates high processing speed.

items.text: He is adept at quickly organizing information.
items.rationale: Quick organization of information is related to processing speed.

items.text: I can rapidly identify errors in written text.
items.rationale: Rapid error identification is a skill associated with processing speed.

items.text: She processes visual information faster than most people.
items.rationale: Fast processing of visual information is a key aspect of processing speed.

items.text: I am quick to respond to new information.
items.rationale: Quick response to new information is indicative of high processing speed.

items.text: He can quickly adapt to changes in his environment.
items.rationale: Quick adaptation to environmental changes is related to processing speed.

items.text: I often find myself completing tasks faster than expected.
items.rationale: Completing tasks faster than expected is a sign of high processing speed.

items.text: She sometimes struggles with tasks that require sustained attention.
items.rationale: Struggling with sustained attention can indicate processing speed challenges.

items.text: I occasionally find it hard to keep up with fast-paced environments.
items.rationale: Difficulty in fast-paced environments can suggest lower processing speed.

items.text: I am good at quickly understanding both visual and verbal information.
items.rationale: This could relate to both processing speed and verbal comprehension.

items.text: I have a large vocabulary and use it effectively.
items.rationale: A large and effective vocabulary is a key aspect of verbal comprehension.

items.text: He understands complex verbal instructions easily.
items.rationale: Understanding complex verbal instructions is indicative of strong verbal comprehension.

items.text: I enjoy engaging in discussions about abstract concepts.
items.rationale: Engaging in discussions about abstract concepts requires verbal comprehension.

items.text: She can explain ideas clearly and concisely.
items.rationale: Clear and concise explanation of ideas is a component of verbal comprehension.

items.text: I am good at understanding the nuances of language.
items.rationale: Understanding language nuances is a key aspect of verbal comprehension.

items.text: He can infer meaning from context in conversations.
items.rationale: Inferring meaning from context is a skill associated with verbal comprehension.

items.text: I often read for pleasure and learning.
items.rationale: Reading for pleasure and learning is related to verbal comprehension.

items.text: She is skilled at summarizing information verbally.
items.rationale: Summarizing information verbally is a component of verbal comprehension.

items.text: I can easily follow complex arguments in discussions.
items.rationale: Following complex arguments requires strong verbal comprehension.

items.text: He enjoys learning new words and their meanings.
items.rationale: Learning new words and meanings is related to verbal comprehension.

items.text: I am adept at understanding different perspectives in conversations.
items.rationale: Understanding different perspectives requires verbal comprehension.

items.text: She sometimes struggles with understanding technical jargon.
items.rationale: Struggling with technical jargon can indicate challenges in verbal comprehension.

items.text: I occasionally find it difficult to articulate my thoughts clearly.
items.rationale: Difficulty articulating thoughts can suggest challenges in verbal comprehension.

items.text: I am good at both understanding verbal instructions and visualizing solutions.
items.rationale: This could relate to both verbal comprehension and perceptual reasoning.

items.text: I can remember a list of items after hearing it once.
items.rationale: Remembering a list of items after hearing it once is a key aspect of working memory.

items.text: He can mentally calculate numbers quickly.
items.rationale: Quick mental calculation is indicative of strong working memory.

items.text: I am able to hold multiple pieces of information in my mind at once.
items.rationale: Holding multiple pieces of information is a hallmark of working memory.

items.text: She can follow multi-step instructions without needing reminders.
items.rationale: Following multi-step instructions requires strong working memory.

items.text: I can easily recall details from conversations.
items.rationale: Recalling details from conversations is related to working memory.

items.text: He is adept at solving problems that require holding information in mind.
items.rationale: Solving problems with held information is a component of working memory.

items.text: I can remember phone numbers after hearing them once.
items.rationale: Remembering phone numbers after hearing them once is a sign of strong working memory.

items.text: She can juggle multiple tasks that require mental effort.
items.rationale: Juggling tasks requiring mental effort is related to working memory.

items.text: I often use mental strategies to remember information.
items.rationale: Using mental strategies to remember information is a working memory skill.

items.text: He can easily recall sequences of numbers or letters.
items.rationale: Recalling sequences of numbers or letters is a component of working memory.

items.text: I am good at tasks that require holding and manipulating information.
items.rationale: Holding and manipulating information is a key aspect of working memory.

items.text: She sometimes struggles with tasks that require sustained mental effort.
items.rationale: Struggling with sustained mental effort can indicate working memory challenges.

items.text: I occasionally find it hard to remember instructions given verbally.
items.rationale: Difficulty remembering verbal instructions can suggest working memory challenges.

items.text: I am good at both remembering information and processing it quickly.
items.rationale: This could relate to both working memory and processing speed.
